Comments_List:
read poems from different angles
read poems in historical contexts

I learned about Du Fu's life and poetry, and also about ways to approach the reading and analysis of Classical Chinese poetry. I appreciated the secondary readings because it was interesting to see how modern scholarship from diverse fields may be brought to bear on Du Fu's work. Professor Bender helped us to think about the texts from angles or perspectives I otherwise may not have thought to do.

secondary readings are often useful and interesting to read

It would be better if we spent more time on specific poems

Professor Bender encourages a lively classroom discussion, which is a strength of this course. I also thought that the discussion board postings were a good exercise every week and helped me to think more critically about the readings.

Yes. Even for students with no background knowledge in the language or poems or the poet, the class will allow them to engage and learn much. I found the course useful since it provides some other perspectives to read the poems

I would recommend this course to other students. It is a great course for students interested in Chinese culture, but also for students of many interests such as literature, philosophy, history, and so on. I think anyone can get a lot out of this course.
